text: Hi everyone. I cloned module to child theme. Then I'm trying to move this module to my custom folder and I'm getting error "*Error.* There was an error moving your content. Please try again". This is my loom video with my actions - <https://www.loom.com/share/495bc6928d4c49f0a88d4f2f7731344b>. What do I wrong?

Hello,
Is it possible to use the get_asset_url tag in a module css file? for example to do:
`background-image: url("{{ get_asset_url('../images/icon/tick-black.svg') }}");` ?
thanks

I’m a beginner and I’m developing my first theme, but I’ve already successfully made up to 10 modules. I faced the problem that fonts cannot be imported into my CSS. I think you have a similar issue and you need to add all the CSS styles to this module or to the general CSS file of the theme. I think internal imports by the link will not work. HubSpot compiles all styles into one, it can be a reason.
